meanings.definition: To line or pack with straw or hay
meanings.sent1: She decided to fother the animal's bed with fresh straw.
meanings.sent2: The farmer will fother the barn before the winter comes.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they helped fother the scarecrow with hay.
meanings.sent4: The cozy nest was carefully fothered with soft feathers.
meanings.sent5: The gardener used a pitchfork to fother the garden path with straw.

meanings.sent1: He had to fother the rug to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent2: The old carpet needed a good fothering to clean it thoroughly.
meanings.sent3: She playfully threatened to fother him with a pillow during the pillow fight.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to fother the leaves off the trees in a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to fother the dough to make it smooth and elastic.
